guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for allopurinol and ABCG2

relatedGenes.name: ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 2 (Junior blood group)

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299107

text.html:
Use 1.25 times the standard dose.
This equates to a dose titration schedule of 100, 200, 400 and 500 mg/day instead of the usual schedule of 100, 200, 300 and 400 mg/day.

implications: The effectiveness of allopurinol is reduced, meaning that a higher dose is required. The gene variation reduces the excretion of uric acid by kidneys and intestines, meaning that a stronger inhibition of the uric acid production by allopurinol is required to achieve the desired uric acid concentration.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299106

text.html:
Use 1.4 times the standard dose.
This equates to a dose titration schedule of 100, 300, 400, 600 and 700 mg/day instead of the usual schedule of 100, 200, 300, 400 and 500 mg/day.

implications: The effectiveness of allopurinol is reduced, meaning that a higher dose is required. The gene variation reduces the excretion of uric acid by kidneys and intestines, meaning that a stronger inhibition of the uric acid production by allopurinol is required to achieve the desired uric acid concentration.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299108

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for allopurinol in patients with the the ABCG2 rs2231142 GG genotype (c.421CC; p.141QQ)

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of the ABCG2 rs2231142 GG genotype (c.421CC; p.141QQ) on allopurinol.
